newsitem.title: TURKEY: Is Bank to use divestment profit in capital rise.
newsitem.headline: Is Bank to use divestment profit in capital rise.

text.p: T. Is Bankasi A.S., one of Turkey's biggest commercial banks said it would use 5.461 trillion lira of profits generated in 1996 from divestment of equity stakes and sale of assets in raising the bank's capital.
Isbank did not give details of the planned capital increase in a statement sent to the Istanbul Stock Exchange. The bank's capital stands at 10 trillion lira.

The bank holds various equity stakes in several industrial and finance firms. Turkish tax laws exempt firms from corporate tax on profits from the sale of assets or equity stakes if the gains are added onto capital.
Isbank's net profits tripled to 38.04 trillion lira in 1996 from 12.04 trillion the previous year.

For each 1,000 lira nominal-valued share, Isbank will pay out a 24,680 lira dividend for A series, 1,203 lira for B series, 400.5 lira for C series and 16.92 million lira per founder share from April 30.
